summary:
Harvard University, located in Cambridge, Massachusetts, is the oldest university in the U.S., founded in 1636. Named after John Harvard, its first donor, Harvard is one of the most prestigious universities globally. It was established by the Massachusetts General Court and initially trained Congregational clergy. In the 19th century, Harvard became a top institution for the Boston elite. After the American Civil War, it expanded with new professional schools.

Harvard has three campuses, the largest in Cambridge, and others in Boston. With an endowment of over $50 billion, it's the wealthiest academic institution worldwide. Harvard boasts an extensive library system and notable alumni, including eight U.S. presidents, Nobel laureates, and Olympic medalists.
title: Harvard University
